result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court calls 21Cf331, 21CM159 & 22CF8  @ 01:52 PM Defendant Neeka S. Hoffmann in court with attorney Brian Thomas Stevens, via zoom.  Elizabeth R. Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. State has complied with victim rights. 21CM159 Not  Guilty plea, Court receives.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court calls 21CF331, 21CM159, & 22CF8  @ 02:58 PM Defendant Neeka S. Hoffmann in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.   Def. has copy of 3 complaints advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. 12-28-21  Bail hearing
Neeka Hoffmann
Court reporter Stacie Pomrening, DCR.
Case called at 11:50 a.m.   Neeka Hoffmann appears by video means from jail. Kelly Hays appears for State. All appearances are by Zoom. State recites anticipated charges: interfering with child custody, felony bail jumping, misd. bail jumping and disorderly conduct, domestic abuse. State heard on bond, recommends $5,000 cash bond with conditions comply with any court orders re: children, no contact with Ed Stainbrook. Court questions Def. as to bond, heard on ability to post. Remarks by the Court. The Court orders $1,000 cash bond with conditions no contact with Ed Stainbrook, comply with any existing court orders regarding her children. Initial appearance Jan. 10, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.
